content.description:
Low Traverse from Left to right. 

  Bring a brush with you. 

  Included here for historical completeness.  I don't know why you'd traverse this boulder when the other problems are so good.

Start on a ledge at the far right end of the boulder.  Head left towards higher flakes. 

  Could use some cleaning.

Start to the right of the birch that is just right of the crack.  Head up and right towards flakes up high. 

  This route is in bad need of a cleaning.
content.location: Right of the birch that is just right of the crack.

content.description: Climb straight up on knobs directly under the highpoint of the left half of the boulder.  If the longer reaches at the top are too much, you can trend left to the hatchet hold of the route on your left.
content.location: A couple feet left of the crack/left facing corner.

content.description: Right hand and foot in the crack/dihedral, left hand and foot on the face.
Climb the slab on quartz knobs up to a left facing hatchet hold at the top.
content.protection: Pad.  The landing slopes a bit to the right.

pathTokens: Boulders Behind the Main Parking Lot/Visitor Center

content.description:
This boulder was left out of Tim Kemple's guide, and has largely been forgotten and overgrown as a result.  Recently, the left half has been well cleaned and some of the highball right half has been cleaned as well.  Hopefully it can see some more traffic and stay clean. 

  The rock quality on this near vertical boulder is excellent and the many quartz crystals make for fun climbing. 

  As far as I know, the problems have no names, so I've just given descriptive titles. 

  I'm horrible at grades, so feedback is appreciated.  I haven't climbed the right side problems in years, so grades are just estimates.
